answers.answer: Lots of people continue the Procrit even after the last week of tx. I only took one shot after tx. but my labs were ok with it. The B12 shots are great, but the sublingual pills are fine too. I'm so glad you are close to the end of tx. That's great. You will make it. I did my CBC's every other week but I think it was overkill. Now I have scar tissue on my best arm.

wooo hooo I am right behind you...I have 10 more to go...I take 1200 mgs of B-12 daily, and I take the pills - Have had my B-12 level checked recently and it is normal - Why do another shot when you can take more pills LOLBest of Luck to you - Beth

GrandmaA   Yes I did find some pill form of the B12 and started taking those this morning.  .. Doc has me going for CBC monthly now, I was on weekly till about a month ago.  I go back to see doc before treatment is over so will find out about procrit and Riba.Elaine ~ I hope Nick is doing OK.  How are you holding up ?  One of my dogs (15 yr old shab  ( shep/lab ) Is driving me nuts.  She is on her way out actually and kind of senile.   Keeps barking at me at 4 am to get up.    Usually its my 12 yr old dobie that starts whining about 5 am to eat.  But this 4 am stuff has got to stop.     I saw a dog for adoption in the paper yesterday, and was so tempted to go get him.. Cute as can be.   But we have these old dogs , yet to deal with.  Piper I expect ( dobie) will be around another 3 years or so.  But she has cancer so no telling.Beth ~ Hope your sx have not been bad for you.  I will take the dose of 1200 on the b-12 and see how that helps.     Really looking forward to being done with treatment, so I can get along with my life.   I hate being so broke, with all my co-pays...  especially since I want to go shopping,   I need new clothes.. LOL after losing 97 lbs.. can say.. NOTHING fits..
You have any early post-tx results yet. If not, when's the first?
oh my gosh you lost 97 pounds!!  holy smoke batman!! I bet you need new clothes, that's a lot of weight loss...Was it because of tx sides?

Yes  from treatment.    Good thing is my diabetes is gone.. completely.. sugar completely normal now.   NO more meds for that.   I went from size 22 to 10.. so not like I didnt need to.  The part that gets me is,   I gained all that weight after treatment 14 years ago.     And became diabetic because of it.   So there is no way that I want to gain even an ounce of it back.. LOL..    But yes definately need new clothes for every moment.   If you knew me and had not seen me while I was going thru treatment.  You would not know me at all.   Totally look different.   I have lifetime friends, who I recently saw, who did not even recognize me.   they were totally looking at me , like.. who is this person who knows us and sounds like Dana, but doesnt look like her..  I went to a Union Greivance meeting yesterday, and the President of our Local did not know who I was.  And I am a steward.   LOL she was looking all puzzled at me, like who are you and why are you here ?  LOL  Not sure if you saw the other picture I posted last week of what I looked like just before starting treatment.  I also have some of time going on thru treatment, while I still had my length of hair, but it was so thin, finally had to cut it off.   Was so thick before.    So hopefully   I do not gain the weight , and I DO grow my hair all back..

wow that's an incredible story...I think it's weird that you got diabetes after you stopped tx - I am involed in an insulen resistance study and they are showing that IR brings on diabetes later on in life - but in most cases when HCV is involved it goes away after you clear the virus..your case is interesting to me..you look wonderful in your pic - you are very pretty and look so peaceful and rested - I hope I look that good once I ge these toxins out of me

What is IR ?   I think the weight gain was what caused the diabetes.    That was 14 years ago on my first time around.  I had all kinds of other medical conditions over the past 14 years, and then found out I had diabetes and the HCV was active again.   I am currently getting ready for shot 43 of 48.. And pray its gone for good this time.   I refuse to gain weight again.  I was 147 when starting 14 years ago.. ended up at 85 lbs after 6 mos of treatment.  Said I was a slow responder, and stopped at 6.  Wanted to send me to Shands in Gainesville , but I said I was not sick till taking those meds.  I will take my chances.  He monitored my levels and they went back to normal levels, and got an UND, and thought I was done.. all gone.   Oh well. I gained the weight and even more.  I tried to lose it but it would not go down more than 10 -15 lbs, and I struggled for years with it.    Now that I have lost all this weight the diabetes is gone, and infact my PCP told me that if I lost the weight, and monitored my sugar intake that It could go away..   Just hope no other medical conditions appear after I am all done this time.

IR is insulen resistant - it means being at high risk for full blown diabetes later on in life - I tested positive for moderate IR - I hope you stay the wya you are and the diabetes never comes back..
:)  wow 6 more to go - don't slow down or I will catch up with ya! hehehe

question: Well I saw both doctors this week.  Hemo says keep going like I am going.   GI I saw yesterday, and went over the Biopsy on the Polyps and all those blood tests.  Says everything was good.  Was not cancerous, and the only thing low is my white blood cells and HGB of course, but that my B12 was low.  So may need some B12 shots, but I will see if I can pick up some pills first and see how the levels do.     Also I asked him if he was going to make me do 52 or let me stop at 48.   He says stop at 48.   So only need to order 1 script of meds, and I will be done.  Whoo Hooo   Only 6 to go..I forgot to ask if I stop Riba the same day, but will see him again before my last doses  What about the Procrit ?  do I stop that then too ?   Any insight there would be helpful.    It feels good to know I am nearing the end of using my belly as a pin cushion.  I am just praying for the result we all want to hear.    I asked the doctor, why Aetna would consider the C19 tumor marker test he ordered, as experimental.  , he said they should not have, its not experimental.. so he is going to help me to appeal that, or try at least.   Question is,   will Quest let me have my blood drawn, if I now owe them money ?    Doc has me doing CBC only 1 time a month now.
title: Final countdown.... Only 6 to go..
